newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX natgas ends down sharply, longs bail.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX natgas ends down sharply, longs bail.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures ended lower across the board Thursday in a quiet, post-bidweek session, with front months down sharply on profit taking and long liquidation after recent gains, industry sources said.
December tumbled 13.6 cents to close at $2.728 per million British thermal units. January settled 13 cents lower at $2.698. Other deferreds ended down by one to 11.6 cents.

"We stalled out early and a lot of specs (speculative longs) had to get out," said one Midwest trader, referring to December's failure to pierce the new contract high of $2.88 set last night on ACCESS.
While most agreed the longer-term technical trend was still higher, some floated the possibility of a technical reversal today after December hit a new contract high and closed sharply lower.
"I don't see a crash, but I wouldn't be surprised to see a pullback into the $2.60s (basis December)," said an East Coast trader.
The Midwest trader agreed. "We're still in a uptrend, but I think we'll see a test of the $2.661 pivot. The key is (cold) weather and if we don't get it, we'll break down."
December resistance was seen at the $2.88 contract high and at $2.92 and $2.98, two prominent spot continuation highs set in late June and early July.

Cash sources said most physical traders were sidelined Thursday waiting for November flows to begin tomorrow. Notionally, Gulf Coast swing gas firmed several cents to the mid-to-high $2.70s on prospects for colder East Coast weather. Midcon pipes notionally were down slightly to the low-to-mid $2.70s.
The 12-month Henry Hub strip slumped 6.3 cents to $2.216. NYMEX said 30,363 Hub contracts traded, down from Wednesday's revised tally of 35,274.

NYMEX December Alberta natgas closed one cent higher at a new contract high of $1.24, while deferreds finished up by 2.5 to five cents. NYMEX said 112 Alberta contracts traded compared with 16 on Wednesday.
NYMEX December Permian natgas ended down by eight cents at $2.61, while deferreds were untraded. NYMEX said 65 Permian lots changed hands versus 45 on Wednesday.

On the KCBT, December finished 12 cents lower at $2.59, while deferreds settled down by one to 10 cents. The December East/West spread narrowed by 1.6 cents to 13.8 cents (NYMEX premium). KCBT said 212 contracts traded, down from Wednesday's total of 502.
